page.title: 04TINTERN VILLAGE
page.content: The village is situated on the western bank of the River Wye and has been forced to extend lengthways along the river due to the steeply rising valley side at this point.It was originally located to utilise the faster flow of water from the valley side for industrial purposes,an advantage now obselete since the development of alternative power sources.There is now,locally,no industry other than Tourism. Tintern simply consists of activities associated with the Abbey and provides six hotels/inns.The petrol pumps,post office,general store/butcher,newsagent and off-licence cater for residents, with a large craft shop and one or two antique shops for tourists. There is a doctors' surgery on the river bank in the middle of the village.
